buildup.text: Sourdough starters are simply flour and water left to attract wild microbes from the environment.

discovery.text: Lactobacillus bacteria produce lactic acid (tangy flavor) while wild yeast produces CO2 (the rise).

twist.text: Ancient Egyptians used sourdough 5,000 years ago. Commercial yeast wasn't available until the 1860s.
